question:
CAM Q: Which FL statute governs condominiums?
A) FS 617
B) FS 718
C) FS 719
D) FS 720
answer:
‚úÖ B) FS 718 ‚Äî The Condominium Act

üß† "718-719-720-721" = Condo-Coop-HOA-Timeshare. They count up!

question:
CAM Q: What 3 things define a community association in FL?
A) Board elections, annual meetings, insurance
B) Mandatory membership, right to vote, assessments can become a lien
C) Voluntary membership, reserve funds, bylaws
D) Property taxes, HOA fees, maintenance
answer:
‚úÖ B) Mandatory membership, right to vote, assessments can become a lien

üß† Remember "MLV" ‚Äî Membership, Lien, Vote.

question:
CAM Q: A CAM license is required when the association budget exceeds:
A) $50,000
B) $75,000
C) $100,000
D) $150,000
answer:
‚úÖ C) $100,000

üß† "100K to unlock the CAM." Applies to ALL association types.

question:
CAM Q: FS 719 is known as the:
A) Condominium Act
B) HOA Act
C) Cooperative Act
D) Timeshare Act
answer:
‚úÖ C) Cooperative Act

üß† "719 = Co-op is Fine." Count: 718 Condo, 719 Co-op, 720 HOA, 721 Timeshare.

question:
CAM Q: Board members owe a fiduciary duty. Which is NOT part of that duty?
A) Duty of care
B) Duty of profitability
C) Duty of loyalty
D) Duty of good faith
answer:
‚úÖ B) Duty of profitability ‚Äî No such thing!

üß† Remember "CGL" ‚Äî Care, Good faith, Loyalty.

question: CAM Q: TRUE or FALSE ‚Äî A paid manager of a mobile home park association with a $90,000 budget needs a CAM license.
answer:
‚úÖ FALSE ‚Äî Threshold is $100,000. At $90K, no license required.

‚ö†Ô∏è Trap: Exam loves amounts just above/below $100K.

question:
CAM Q: Which has the HIGHEST authority over an association?
A) Declaration
B) Bylaws
C) Rules & Regulations
D) Federal & State Law
answer:
‚úÖ D) Federal & State Law ‚Äî ALWAYS trumps everything.

üß† Hierarchy: Law > Declaration > Articles > Bylaws > Rules.

question:
CAM Q: A board member secretly hires her husband's company at above-market rates. Which fiduciary duty did she violate?
A) Care
B) Loyalty
C) Good faith
D) All of the above
answer:
‚úÖ B) Loyalty ‚Äî She put personal interests above the association's.

üß† "CGL" ‚Äî Loyalty = association comes FIRST.

question:
CAM Q: The Declaration of Condominium is BEST described as:
A) The operating procedures
B) The document that creates the condo and defines units & common elements
C) The annual budget
D) The management contract
answer:
‚úÖ B) Creates the condo and defines what you own vs. what's shared.

üß† Declaration = "birth certificate" of the condo. Filed with the county.

question:
CAM Q: How much notice is required for a board meeting in a condo?
A) 24 hours
B) 48 hours
C) 7 days
D) 14 days
answer:
‚úÖ B) 48 hours ‚Äî Posted continuously.

üß† "48-14 Rule": 48hrs for BOARD (small group), 14 DAYS for MEMBERS (big group).

question:
CAM Q: A homeowner says "I didn't agree to join this HOA, so I don't have to pay." Are they correct?
A) Yes, membership is voluntary
B) No, membership is mandatory when you purchase
C) Yes, if they didn't sign a separate agreement
D) It depends on the bylaws
answer:
‚úÖ B) Membership is MANDATORY. Buy the property = automatic member.

üß† "MLV" ‚Äî M is for MANDATORY. No opt-out.

question:
CAM Q: How many days' advance notice must members receive before an annual meeting?
A) 7 days
B) 10 days
C) 14 days
D) 30 days
answer:
‚úÖ C) 14 days ‚Äî Mailed or delivered.

üß† "48-14 Rule" again! 48hrs=board. 14 days=members, budgets, elections.

question:
CAM Q: A condo association with $350,000 in annual revenue needs:
A) Cash report
B) Compiled statements
C) Reviewed statements
D) Audited statements
answer:
‚úÖ C) Reviewed financial statements ($300K-$499K)

üß† "1-3-5 Climb": $150K=Compiled, $300K=Reviewed, $500K=Audited.

question:
CAM Q: A board posts meeting notice at 2pm Tuesday. The earliest the meeting can be held is:
A) Tuesday evening
B) Wednesday 2pm
C) Thursday 2pm
D) Next Tuesday
answer:
‚úÖ C) Thursday 2pm ‚Äî 48 hours of continuous posted notice.

üß† 48 hours = 2 full days. Tuesday 2pm ‚Üí Thursday 2pm.

question:
CAM Q: The 3 components of fiduciary duty are:
A) Honesty, transparency, accountability
B) Care, good faith, loyalty
C) Diligence, fairness, profitability
D) Trust, integrity, service
answer:
‚úÖ B) Care, Good faith, Loyalty

üß† "CGL" ‚Äî Should be automatic by now! Care=diligent, Good faith=honest, Loyalty=association first.

question:
CAM Q: Before recording a lien for unpaid condo assessments, the association must send notice at least:
A) 14 days before
B) 30 days before
C) 45 days before
D) 60 days before
answer:
‚úÖ B) 30 days ‚Äî By certified mail.

üß† "30 for Condo, 45 for HOA." Condos are compact = faster process.

question:
CAM Q: A condo association records a lien for unpaid assessments. How long is it effective?
A) 6 months
B) 1 year
C) 2 years
D) 5 years
answer:
‚úÖ B) 1 year from the date the claim of lien was recorded.

üß† "1 year to act on the lien." Must foreclose or re-record.

question:
CAM Q: A board rule conflicts with the Declaration. Which prevails?
A) The board rule, since it's newer
B) The Declaration
C) Whichever the CAM prefers
D) Neither ‚Äî they cancel out
answer:
‚úÖ B) The Declaration ‚Äî outranks rules & bylaws.

üß† Hierarchy: Law > Declaration > Articles > Bylaws > Rules. Higher always wins.

question:
CAM Q: Which insurance protects against employee theft of association funds?
A) Property insurance
B) D&O insurance
C) Fidelity bond
D) Workers' comp
answer:
‚úÖ C) Fidelity bond ‚Äî Covers dishonesty/theft by anyone handling funds.

üß† "Fidelity = Faithfulness." Ensures people stay faithful with the money.

question:
CAM Q: Match: Condos=___, Co-ops=___, HOAs=___, Timeshares=___
A) 720, 718, 719, 721
B) 718, 719, 720, 721
C) 718, 720, 719, 721
D) 719, 718, 721, 720
answer:
‚úÖ B) 718, 719, 720, 721 ‚Äî They count up in order!

üß† "718-719-720-721 = Condo-Coop-HOA-Time." 7th time seeing this!

question:
CAM Q: An HOA has a $120,000 budget and hires a manager. Does the manager need a CAM license?
A) No, HOAs are exempt
B) Yes, budget exceeds $100,000
C) Only if 50+ units
D) Only if full-time
answer:
‚úÖ B) Yes ‚Äî $100K threshold applies to ALL association types.

‚ö†Ô∏è Trap: ALL types count, not just condos.

question:
CAM Q: Can proxies be used for board elections in a FL condo?
A) Yes, always
B) Yes, if bylaws allow
C) No, secret written ballot required
D) Only for absentee voters
answer:
‚úÖ C) NO proxies for condo board elections. Secret ballot ONLY.

‚ö†Ô∏è TOP EXAM TRAP! Proxies work for other votes, NEVER for condo board elections.

question:
CAM Q: A fidelity bond must cover:
A) Only the CAM
B) Only board members
C) All persons who control or disburse funds
D) Only full-time employees
answer:
‚úÖ C) ALL persons who control or disburse funds ‚Äî Board, CAM, employees, management staff.

üß† "Fidelity = Faithfulness with FUNDS." Everyone touching money needs coverage.

question:
CAM Q: An association with $480,000 revenue needs what type of financial report?
A) Compiled
B) Reviewed
C) Audited
D) Cash report
answer:
‚úÖ B) Reviewed ‚Äî $300K-$499K. NOT audited (that's $500K+).

üß† "1-3-5 Climb": $480K is below the $500K audited line.

question:
CAM Q: The default quorum for a condo MEMBER meeting is:
A) 10%
B) 20%
C) 30%
D) 51%
answer:
‚úÖ C) 30% of total voting interests (unless bylaws say otherwise).

‚ö†Ô∏è Don't confuse with BOARD quorum = majority of directors. 30% is for MEMBERS only.

question:
CAM Q: In a condo, 3 open board seats and only 3 candidates. What happens?
A) Election must still be held
B) Candidates seated by acclamation
C) Board appoints them
D) Special meeting called
answer:
‚úÖ B) Seated by acclamation. No election needed when candidates ‚â§ seats.

üß† "Equal or fewer = no need to choose."

question:
CAM Q: A board member makes a decision without reading the financial report. Which duty breached?
A) Loyalty
B) Good faith
C) Care
D) Profitability
answer:
‚úÖ C) Care ‚Äî Duty of care = acting with reasonable diligence. Not reading reports = careless.

üß† "CGL" ‚Äî Care is about DOING YOUR HOMEWORK.

question:
CAM Q: An owner requests official records. The association must provide access within:
A) 5 business days
B) 10 business days
C) 15 business days
D) 30 days
answer:
‚úÖ B) 10 business days of a written request.

üß† "10 to show the records." Fail? Association pays owner's attorney fees!

question:
CAM Q: An HO-6 policy is carried by:
A) The association
B) The management company
C) The individual unit owner
D) The developer
answer:
‚úÖ C) Unit owner carries HO-6 (interior, personal property, liability).

üß† Association = "studs OUT." Owner = "studs IN." HO-6 = owner's policy.

question:
CAM Q: Rank HIGHEST to LOWEST: Bylaws, State Law, Declaration, Rules
A) Rules > Bylaws > Declaration > State Law
B) State Law > Declaration > Bylaws > Rules
C) Declaration > State Law > Rules > Bylaws
D) Bylaws > Declaration > Rules > State Law
answer:
‚úÖ B) State Law > Declaration > Bylaws > Rules

üß† "Government on top." Law > Declaration > Articles > Bylaws > Rules.

question:
CAM Q: Can reserves for SIRS items (roof, structure, etc.) be waived by owner vote?
A) Yes, by majority
B) Yes, by 75%
C) No, SIRS reserves cannot be waived
D) Only with DBPR approval
answer:
‚úÖ C) SIRS reserves CANNOT be waived or reduced. Period. (Effective 2025)

‚ö†Ô∏è Other reserves CAN be waived. SIRS items? NEVER.

question: CAM Q: TRUE or FALSE ‚Äî A condo owner can give their neighbor a proxy to vote in a board election.
answer:
‚úÖ FALSE ‚Äî No proxies for condo board elections! Secret ballot ONLY.

üß† #1 exam trap. Proxies for OTHER votes = OK. Board elections = NEVER.

question:
CAM Q: Fill in: Board meetings need ___ hours notice. Member meetings need ___ days notice.
A) 24 / 7
B) 48 / 14
C) 72 / 30
D) 48 / 7
answer:
‚úÖ B) 48 hours / 14 days

üß† "48-14 Rule" ‚Äî Should be automatic by now!

question:
CAM Q: A proxy for a FL condo association is valid for how many days?
A) 30
B) 60
C) 90
D) 120
answer:
‚úÖ D) 120 days for condos. (HOAs = 90 days)

üß† "Condos TALLER = LONGER proxy (120). HOAs SHORTER = shorter proxy (90)."

question:
CAM Q: Which is NOT covered by a SIRS?
A) Roof & load-bearing walls
B) Interior unit appliances
C) Plumbing & electrical
D) Fire protection & windows
answer:
‚úÖ B) Interior unit appliances ‚Äî owner's responsibility.

üß† "REPS FLEW" = Roof, Electrical, Plumbing, Structure, Fire, Load-bearing, Exterior waterproofing, Windows.

question:
CAM Q: 100-unit condo. How many voting interests needed for a member meeting quorum?
A) 10
B) 20
C) 30
D) 51
answer:
‚úÖ C) 30 ‚Äî That's 30% of 100 units.

‚ö†Ô∏è 30% = MEMBER meetings. BOARD quorum = majority of directors. Don't mix up!

question:
CAM Q: To recall a board member, you need a vote of:
A) Majority of members present
B) Majority of ALL voting interests
C) Two-thirds of all voting interests
D) Unanimous vote
answer:
‚úÖ B) Majority of ALL voting interests ‚Äî not just those present!

‚ö†Ô∏è Trap: "Majority present" is wrong. Must be majority of EVERYONE.

question:
CAM Q: Lien notice periods: Condo = ___ days, HOA = ___ days.
A) 14 / 30
B) 30 / 45
C) 45 / 60
D) 30 / 30
answer:
‚úÖ B) 30 days condo / 45 days HOA

üß† "30 Condo, 45 HOA" ‚Äî Condos compact = faster. HOAs spread = slower.

question:
CAM Q: An HOA proxy signed on Jan 1 expires on:
A) Jan 31
B) March 1
C) April 1 (90 days)
D) May 1 (120 days)
answer:
‚úÖ C) April 1 ‚Äî HOA proxies = 90 days. (Condo proxies = 120 days)

üß† "HOA = 90, Condo = 120."

question:
CAM Q: Quick fire ‚Äî name the statute:
Condos? Co-ops? HOAs? Timeshares? CAM licensing?
answer:
‚úÖ 718, 719, 720, 721, 468 Part VIII

üß† "718-719-720-721" counts up. 468 = license gate. FS 617 = corporate law. ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question: CAM Q: Complete: Every community association has 3 defining features ‚Äî M___, L___, V___.
answer:
‚úÖ Membership (mandatory), Lien (assessments become liens), Vote (right to vote)

üß† "MLV" ‚Äî If instant recall, you own this. ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question: CAM Q: Your friend manages a 40-unit HOA with $110K budget. Does she need a CAM license?
answer:
‚úÖ YES ‚Äî Budget exceeds $100,000. Applies to ALL association types.

üß† "$100K = CAM key." If answered in under 3 seconds ‚Äî exam-ready. ‚úÖ

question:
CAM Q: A developer must turn over control of a condo association no later than:
A) 3 years
B) 5 years
C) 7 years
D) 10 years
answer:
‚úÖ C) 7 years after recording the declaration.

üß† "937" = 90% conveyed ‚Üí 3 months turnover, OR max 7 years.

question:
CAM Q: Name 2 TRUE things about condo board elections:
1) Proxies allowed  2) Secret ballot  3) CAM can vote  4) Acclamation if candidates ‚â§ seats
answer:
‚úÖ 2 and 4 ‚Äî Secret ballot required, acclamation if candidates ‚â§ seats.

‚ö†Ô∏è Proxies = NO. CAM voting = NO.

question: CAM Q: A condo proxy signed March 1 is still valid on June 15 (106 days later). TRUE or FALSE?
answer:
‚úÖ TRUE ‚Äî Condo proxies valid 120 days. 106 < 120.

üß† "Condo=120, HOA=90." June 15 too late for HOA but fine for condo.

question:
CAM Q: Milestone inspections are required for buildings that are:
A) 2+ stories
B) 3+ stories
C) 5+ stories
D) 10+ stories
answer:
‚úÖ B) 3 stories or taller (FS 553.899)

üß† "3 stories = inspection stories." Phase 1 by year 30 (or 25 if within 3mi of coast).

question:
CAM Q: 90% of condo units sold. How long does developer have to turn over control?
A) Immediately
B) 3 months
C) 6 months
D) 1 year
answer:
‚úÖ B) 3 months after 90% conveyed.

üß† "937" ‚Äî 90% ‚Üí 3 months. Or max 7 years regardless.

question:
CAM Q: Board meeting with 5 directors. How many for quorum?
A) 1
B) 2
C) 3
D) 5
answer:
‚úÖ C) 3 ‚Äî Majority of directors. 3/5 = majority.

‚ö†Ô∏è Board = majority of DIRECTORS. Members = 30% of VOTING INTERESTS. Different!

question:
CAM Q: A CAM temporarily deposits association funds into their personal account. This is:
A) Acceptable if temporary
B) Prohibited ‚Äî commingling
C) Allowed with board approval
D) Fine if documented
answer:
‚úÖ B) PROHIBITED. Commingling is NEVER acceptable, not even temporarily.

üß† "Never mix the money." Separate accounts. Always. No exceptions.

question:
CAM Q: After a valid recall vote, the board must meet to certify or reject within:
A) 3 business days
B) 5 full business days
C) 10 business days
D) 30 days
answer:
‚úÖ B) 5 full business days. If rejected ‚Üí DBPR arbitration.

üß† "5 to certify, DBPR if they deny."

question:
CAM Q: A 4-story condo 2 miles from coast. Phase 1 inspection due by building age:
A) 20 years
B) 25 years
C) 30 years
D) 40 years
answer:
‚úÖ B) 25 years ‚Äî Within 3mi of coast = year 25. Beyond 3mi = year 30.

üß† "Coast=25, Inland=30." Salt air corrodes faster ‚Üí earlier check.

question:
CAM Q: Bank forecloses on condo. "Safe harbor" owed to association is lesser of:
A) 6mo assessments or 1% mortgage
B) 12mo assessments or 1% of original mortgage
C) 24mo assessments or 2% mortgage
D) All past-due assessments
answer:
‚úÖ B) Lesser of 12 months assessments OR 1% of original mortgage.

üß† "12 and 1" ‚Äî 12 months or 1 percent, whichever is LESS.

question: CAM Q: TRUE or FALSE ‚Äî Association can vote to use SIRS roof reserve funds for a new pool.
answer:
‚úÖ FALSE ‚Äî SIRS reserves are LOCKED. Cannot be waived, reduced, or redirected. Ever.

üß† Non-SIRS = voteable. SIRS = untouchable. Post-Surfside = no shortcuts.

question: CAM Q: Without looking ‚Äî board notice = ___hrs. Member notice = ___days. Go!
answer:
‚úÖ 48 hours / 14 days

üß† "48-14 Rule" ‚Äî If instant, it's permanently locked in. ‚úÖ

question:
CAM Q: Material alterations to condo common elements require approval of:
A) Board only
B) 51% of owners
C) 75% of owners
D) 100% of owners
answer:
‚úÖ C) 75% of all owners (unless docs specify differently).

üß† "75 to alter." Major changes to shared property need a supermajority.

question:
CAM Q: Phase 1 inspection finds substantial structural deterioration. What next?
A) Building condemned
B) Phase 2 inspection required
C) Association dissolved
D) Nothing, advisory only
answer:
‚úÖ B) Phase 2 ‚Äî More detailed inspection with repair recommendations.

üß† "Phase 1=look. Phase 2=look CLOSER." Results to owners within 45 days.

question: CAM Q: Spell out "CGL" in fiduciary duty context. No peeking!
answer:
‚úÖ Care, Good faith, Loyalty

üß† If instant ‚Äî LOCKED. CGL is exam gold across multiple questions. ‚úÖ

question:
CAM Q: Board asks CAM for legal advice about a lawsuit. The CAM should:
A) Give their best legal opinion
B) Decline and recommend the association's attorney
C) Research the law and advise
D) Ask management company's lawyer
answer:
‚úÖ B) Decline and refer to attorney. CAM is NOT a lawyer.

üß† "CAM ‚â† Attorney, CAM ‚â† Board member." Implements & manages ‚Äî doesn't practice law or vote.

question:
CAM Q: 200-unit condo. To recall a board member, how many votes needed?
A) 51
B) 60
C) 101
D) 150
answer:
‚úÖ C) 101 ‚Äî Majority of ALL 200 voting interests.

‚ö†Ô∏è Not "present" or "voting." Majority of ALL interests.

question: CAM Q: What document creates the condo, defines units & common elements, and is filed with the county?
answer:
‚úÖ The Declaration of Condominium

üß† "Birth certificate of the condo." If you said it before finishing reading ‚Äî you're ready. ‚úÖ

question:
CAM Q: Rapid fire ‚Äî report needed at each level?
$100K? $200K? $400K? $600K?
answer:
‚úÖ $100K=Cash | $200K=Compiled | $400K=Reviewed | $600K=Audited

üß† "1-3-5 Climb": <$150K=cash, $150K=compiled, $300K=reviewed, $500K=audited. ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question:
CAM Q: Association records belong to:
A) The management company
B) The CAM personally
C) The association
D) The board president
answer:
‚úÖ C) The ASSOCIATION ‚Äî always. Even if management company maintains them.

‚ö†Ô∏è If management co. is fired, they must return ALL records. Never "theirs."

question: CAM Q: Lien notice: Condo=___days. HOA=___days. Lien effective=___year(s). Go!
answer:
‚úÖ Condo=30 | HOA=45 | Effective=1 year

üß† "30-45-1" ‚Äî If you rattled that off, it's permanent memory. ‚úÖ

question:
CAM Q: "Replacement cost" insurance differs from "actual cash value" because:
A) Includes profit margin
B) Does NOT deduct for depreciation
C) Always cheaper
D) Only covers common elements
answer:
‚úÖ B) Replacement cost = full cost, NO depreciation deduction.

üß† "Replacement=FULL price. ACV=depreciated." Associations should insure for full replacement cost.

question:
CAM Q: Match: Fidelity=___, D&O=___, HO-6=___, Workers comp=___
A) Theft, Board liability, Owner interior, Employee injuries
B) Fire, Theft, Flood, Liability
answer:
‚úÖ A) Fidelity=Theft, D&O=Board liability, HO-6=Owner interior, WC=Employee injuries

üß† Each insurance has ONE job. ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question:
CAM Q: The "937 rule" means:
A) 9 months, 3 phases, 7 documents
B) 90% conveyed ‚Üí 3 months turnover, OR max 7 years
C) $9M budget, 3 members, 7 year term
answer:
‚úÖ B) 90% conveyed ‚Üí 3 months, OR 7 years max.

üß† "937" ‚Äî three digits, one rule. See turnover ‚Üí think 937.

question:
CAM Q: Under Robert's Rules, correct order:
A) Discussion ‚Üí Motion ‚Üí Vote
B) Motion ‚Üí Second ‚Üí Discussion ‚Üí Vote
C) Vote ‚Üí Motion ‚Üí Discussion
answer:
‚úÖ B) Motion ‚Üí Second ‚Üí Discussion ‚Üí Vote

üß† "MSDV" ‚Äî Motions Should Drive Votes.

question: CAM Q: TRUE or FALSE ‚Äî Proxies can be used for condo board elections.
answer:
‚úÖ FALSE. Secret written ballot ONLY. No proxies. EVER.

üß† If you screamed "FALSE!" before finishing ‚Äî this trap will never catch you. ‚úÖ‚úÖ

question: CAM Q: Bank forecloses on condo. Safe harbor = lesser of ___mo assessments or ___% of original mortgage.
answer:
‚úÖ 12 months or 1% ‚Äî whichever is LESS.

üß† "12 and 1" ‚Äî Bank pays the smaller amount.

question:
CAM Q: DBPR regulates which associations?
A) HOAs and condos
B) Condos, co-ops, and timeshares
C) Only condos
D) All community associations
answer:
‚úÖ B) Condos, co-ops, timeshares. NOT HOAs!

‚ö†Ô∏è Exam trap: DBPR does NOT regulate HOAs.

question: CAM Q: Member quorum = ___%. Board quorum = ___ of directors.
answer:
‚úÖ 30% for members. Majority for board.

üß† Both instant? LOCKED. Two rules, two contexts. ‚úÖ

question: CAM Q: Milestone: ___stories+, year___(or___near coast). Phase 2 triggered by___.
answer:
‚úÖ 3+ stories, year 30 (or 25 within 3mi coast), Phase 2 by substantial structural deterioration.

üß† "3-30-25" + results to owners within 45 days.

question:
CAM Q: When evaluating contractor bids, consider:
A) Only lowest price
B) Performance, references, insurance, cost, experience
C) Only local contractors
answer:
‚úÖ B) All five factors.

üß† "PRICE" ‚Äî Performance, References, Insurance, Cost, Experience. Cheapest isn't always best!

question: CAM Q: Can SIRS reserves be waived? Can OTHER reserves be waived? Answer both.
answer:
‚úÖ SIRS=NO, never. Other reserves=YES, by majority member vote.

üß† SIRS=untouchable. Others=voteable. KNOW THE DIFFERENCE. ‚úÖ

question: CAM Q: Records response=___business days. Copy charge=$___/page. Penalty=___.
answer:
‚úÖ 10 days. $0.25/page. Association pays member's attorney fees.

üß† "10 days, quarter a page, you pay their lawyer." ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question: CAM Q: Proxy validity: Condo=___days. HOA=___days. Proxies for condo board elections?___
answer:
‚úÖ 120 condo. 90 HOA. NO proxies for condo board elections.

üß† Three facts, instant recall. Topic DONE. ‚úÖ

question: CAM Q: Recall requires majority of___. Board has___business days to certify. If rejected‚Üí___.
answer:
‚úÖ ALL voting interests. 5 business days. DBPR arbitration.

üß† "All, 5, DBPR." Three-word answer. ‚úÖ LOCKED.

question:
CAM Q: Board wants to convert tennis court to dog park. Vote needed?
A) Board only
B) 51% owners
C) 75% owners
D) Unanimous
answer:
‚úÖ C) 75% ‚Äî Material alteration to common elements.

üß† "75 to alter." Board can maintain but can't fundamentally CHANGE alone.

question: CAM Q: TRUE or FALSE ‚Äî Developer has no fiduciary duty while controlling the board.
answer:
‚úÖ FALSE! Developer has SAME fiduciary duties as any board member.

‚ö†Ô∏è Top exam trap. Developer is NOT exempt. CGL applies to EVERYONE on the board.

question: CAM Q: Developer turnover: "937" = ___% conveyed ‚Üí ___months, OR max___years.
answer:
‚úÖ 90% ‚Üí 3 months, OR 7 years max.

answer:
